intro: Godetia micropetala, commonly known as the narrow-petaled godetia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving it a soft texture. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
